description: From Middle English commendable, from Middle French commendable, from Latin commendabilis, from commendare (“to commend, intrust to”), from com- + mandare (“to commit, intrust, enjoin”), from manus (“hand”) + dare (“to put”).

adjectives.description: commendable (comparative more commendable, superlative most commendable)

entries.meaning: Worthy of commendation; deserving praise; admirable, creditable, or meritorious.
